panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: sidekiq Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

Monitors ratio between all received emails and received emails which
could not be processed for some reason.

panels.title: global_search_indexing SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

The number of Global Search indexing calls meeting their duration target based on the 99.95th percentile of
indexing. This indicates the duration between when an item was changed and when it became available in Elasticsearch.

The target duration can be found here:
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/lib/gitlab/metrics/global_search_indexing_slis.rb#L14-L15

panels.title: Details

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: shard_elasticsearch SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="shard_elasticsearch",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="shard_elasticsearch",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_elasticsearch",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="shard_elasticsearch",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_elasticsearch",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="shard_elasticsearch",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_elasticsearch",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="shard_elasticsearch",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_elasticsearch",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

  or

    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="shard_elasticsearch",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="shard_elasticsearch",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="shard_elasticsearch",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="shard_elasticsearch",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="shard_elasticsearch",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="shard_elasticsearch",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

panels.content:

Aggregation of all jobs for the elasticsearch Sidekiq shard.

panels.title: Details

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: shard_gitaly_throttled SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="shard_gitaly_throttled",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: shard_gitaly_throttled SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of all jobs for the gitaly-throttled Sidekiq shard.

panels.title: Details

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: shard_low_urgency_cpu_bound SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="shard_low_urgency_cpu_bound",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="shard_low_urgency_cpu_bound",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_low_urgency_cpu_bound",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="shard_low_urgency_cpu_bound",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_low_urgency_cpu_bound",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="shard_low_urgency_cpu_bound",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_low_urgency_cpu_bound",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="shard_low_urgency_cpu_bound",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_low_urgency_cpu_bound",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="shard_low_urgency_cpu_bound",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="shard_low_urgency_cpu_bound",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(

    "period", "30m", "", ""

    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of all jobs for the low-urgency-cpu-bound Sidekiq shard.



### Observability Tools

panels.content:

Aggregation of all jobs for the memory-bound Sidekiq shard.

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: shard_urgent_cpu_bound SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="shard_urgent_cpu_bound",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="shard_urgent_cpu_bound",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_urgent_cpu_bound",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="shard_urgent_cpu_bound",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_urgent_cpu_bound",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="shard_urgent_cpu_bound",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_urgent_cpu_bound",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="shard_urgent_cpu_bound",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_urgent_cpu_bound",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

panels.content:

Aggregation of all jobs for the urgent-cpu-bound Sidekiq shard.

panels.title: Details

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: shard_urgent_other SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="shard_urgent_other",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="shard_urgent_other",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_urgent_other",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="shard_urgent_other",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_urgent_other",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="shard_urgent_other",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_urgent_other",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="shard_urgent_other",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="shard_urgent_other",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="shard_urgent_other",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="shard_urgent_other",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="shard_urgent_other",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="shard_urgent_other",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="shard_urgent_other",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="shard_urgent_other",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="shard_urgent_other",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="shard_urgent_other",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="shard_urgent_other",monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: shard_urgent_other SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of all jobs for the urgent-other Sidekiq shard.



### Observability Tools

panels.description:
Ratio of requested CPU resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by memory requests already.
panels.title: Node CPU Requests Utilization

panels.description:
Ratio of requested Memory resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by CPU requests already.
panels.title: Node Memory Requests Utilization

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Records the total anonymous (unevictable) memory utilization for containers for this
service, as a percentage of the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.

This is computed using the container's resident set size (RSS), as opposed to
kube_container_memory which uses the working set size. For our purposes, RSS is the
better metric as cAdvisor's working set calculation includes pages from the
filesystem cache that can (and will) be evicted before the OOM killer kills the
cgroup.

A container's RSS (anonymous memory usage) is still not precisely what the OOM
killer will use, but it's a better approximation of what the container's workload is
actually using. RSS metrics can, however, be dramatically inflated if a process in
the container uses MADV_FREE (lazy-free) memory. RSS will include the memory that is
available to be reclaimed without a page fault, but not currently in use.

The most common case of OOM kills is for anonymous memory demand to overwhelm the
container's memory limit. On swapless hosts, anonymous memory cannot be evicted from
the page cache, so when a container's memory usage is mostly anonymous pages, the
only remaining option to relieve memory pressure may be the OOM killer.

As container RSS approaches container memory limit, OOM kills become much more
likely. Consequently, this ratio is a good leading indicator of memory saturation
and OOM risk.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_rss:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_rss component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization (RSS)

panels.description:
The [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/)
automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler has a configured upper maximum. When this
limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and other
resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, horizontalpodautoscaler, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      /
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_desired_replicas component saturation: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler Desired Replicas

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in the node pool for
a service fleet.

If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total:labeled{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_pool_cpu component saturation: Average Node Pool CPU Utilization

panels.description:
A GKE kubernetes node pool is close to it's maximum number of nodes.

The maximum is defined in terraform, via the `max_node_count` field of a node pool. The limit is per-zone, so for
single zone clusters the number of nodes will match the limit, for regional clusters, the limit is multiplied by
the number of zones the cluster is deployed over.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(env, environment, tier, type, stage, shard, cluster, label_pool, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      count by (cluster, env, environment, label_pool, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        kube_node_labels:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}
      )
      / on(cluster, env, environment, label_pool) group_left() (
        label_replace(
          terraform_report_google_cluster_node_pool_max_node_count,
          "label_pool", "$0", "pool_name", ".*"
        )
        * on(cluster, env, environment) group_left()
        count by (cluster, env, environment) (
          group by (cluster, env, environment, label_topology_kubernetes_io_zone) (
            kube_node_labels:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}
          )
        )
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_pool_max_nodes component saturation: Kube Pool Max Node Limit

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
Rails uses connection pools for its database connections. As each
node may have multiple connection pools, this is by node and by
database host.

Read more about this resource in our [documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/database/client_side_connection_pool.html#client-side-connection-pool).

If this resource is saturated, it may indicate that our connection
pools are not correctly sized, perhaps because an unexpected
application thread is using a database connection.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, instance, host, port) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        avg_over_time(gitlab_database_connection_pool_busy{class="ActiveRecord::Base", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[5m])
        +
        avg_over_time(gitlab_database_connection_pool_dead{class="ActiveRecord::Base", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[5m])
      )
      /
      gitlab_database_connection_pool_size{class="ActiveRecord::Base", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: rails_db_connection_pool component saturation: Rails DB Connection Pool Utilization

panels.description:
Ruby (technically Ruby MRI), like some other scripting languages, uses a Global VM lock (GVL) also known as a
Global Interpreter Lock (GIL) to ensure that multiple threads can execute safely. Ruby code is only allowed to
execute in one thread in a process at a time. When calling out to c extensions, the thread can cede the lock to
other thread while it continues to execute.

This means that when CPU-bound workloads run in a multithreaded environment such as Puma or Sidekiq, contention
with other Ruby worker threads running in the same process can occur, effectively slowing thoses threads down as
they await GVL entry.

Often the best fix for this situation is to add more workers by scaling up the fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    quantile by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn, pod) (
  0.99,
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      rate(ruby_process_cpu_seconds_total{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[1h])
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: ruby_thread_contention component saturation: Ruby Thread Contention

panels.description:
Sidekiq worker utilization per shard.

This metric represents the percentage of available threads*workers that are actively processing jobs.

When this metric is saturated, new Sidekiq jobs will queue. Depending on whether or not the jobs are latency sensitive,
this could impact user experience.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, shard) (
        avg_over_time(sidekiq_running_jobs{shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, shard) (
        avg_over_time(sidekiq_concurrency{shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: sidekiq_shard_workers component saturation: Sidekiq Worker Utilization per shard

panels.description:
Puma thread utilization per node.

Puma uses a fixed size thread pool to handle HTTP requests. This metric shows how many threads are busy handling requests. When this resource is saturated,
we will see puma queuing taking place. Leading to slowdowns across the application.

Puma saturation is usually caused by latency problems in downstream services: usually Gitaly or Postgres, but possibly also Redis.
Puma saturation can also be caused by traffic spikes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn) (avg_over_time(instance:puma_active_connections:sum{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[1m]))
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn) (instance:puma_max_threads:sum{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"})
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

These jobs are created when projects are imported or when Elasticsearch is enabled for a group in order to backfill all project data to the index. These are picked up in batches every minute. Lower is better but the batching every minute means it will not usually stay at 0. Sudden spikes are expected if a large group is enabled for Elasticsearch but sustained steady growth over a long period of time may indicate that ElasticIndexInitialBulkCronWorker is not keeping up.
